text: Victor Mizzy (January 9, 1916 â€“ October 17, 2009) was an American composer. His best-known works are the themes to the 1960s television sitcoms Green Acres and The Addams Family. Mizzy also wrote top-20 songs from the 1930s to 1940s. He was born in New York City. Mizzy died at his home in Bel Air, California, on October 17, 2009, aged 93. ==References== Category:1916 births Category:2009 deaths Category:American composers Category:Singers from New York City Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Vic Mizzy
